If a new transformation \\(k(z) = e^{-i\\omega t}z\\) is applied as an intervention at time \\(t_1\\), will the state \\(z(T)\\) at t = T strictly depend on the matrix A and not on \\(\\omega\\)?

The interaction of these complex exponentials affects the trajectory and final state of the system.
